bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench's secretary to John J. Moran, March 24, 1938

div1.p: Hench's secretary returns Moran's photographs and requests that he autograph and return the recent portraits.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench's secretary to John J. Moran, March 24, 1938
div1.opener:
March 24, 1938
Mr. John J. Moran
c/o Cia. Sunoco de Cuba, S.A.
Avenida Menocal No. 102-A
Havana, Cuba
Dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
In Dr. Hench's temporary absence from
the Clinic, I am returning to you the two photographs
taken in 1910 and 1918 respectively, from which Dr.
Hench has had slides made, and your two recent
photographs, both of which Dr. Hench would like you
to autograph and return, at your convenience.
